item.title: Let’s not idolize AI. That’s an age-old mistake.
item.description: In every generation, some advanced piece of machinery comes to seem like a model of the human mind.

item.title: The last act of the feature film
item.description: Netflix’s purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery could mean curtains for going to the movies.

item.title: ‘Relax’ is not a winning economic message
item.description: Consumers estimate they’ll spend an average of $778 on holiday presents, down from $1,012 last year.

item.title: There’s no middle ground on the boat strikes
item.description: The second strike matters less than the warped policy that justified the operation at all.

item.title: Grab some popcorn for the political battle over this movie mega merger
item.description: Warner Bros. is the cursed monkey’s paw of the entertainment industry.

item.title: The World Cup draw, always ridiculous, outdid itself with Trump
item.description: Soccer fans just want to know who their team will be playing. FIFA has other ideas.

item.title: The National Security Strategy is less a strategy than a mood board
item.description: The Trump administration attempts to define “America First” in the broadest possible terms.

item.title: The CDC’s change to hepatitis B vaccination is even worse than it seems
item.description: The new recommendations portend even more harmful shifts ahead.

item.title: The gerrymandering doom cycle gets more ridiculous
item.description: As the Supreme Court lets Texas use its new map, the Florida GOP looks to squeeze three more seats.

item.title: Move over, ‘Soup Nazi.’ Behold Trump’s absurd new phrase.
item.description: Caribbean boat strikes, Marjorie Taylor and Southwest water use, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: Pregnancy resource centers help women. They don’t ‘torture’ them.
item.description: Officials in blue states are going after the facilities for all the wrong reasons.

item.title: I found out my father was a war hero — at his funeral decades later
item.description: ‘Secret war heroes,’ lost medals and unknown valor, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: Trump’s closure of Voice of America is coming back to bite him
item.description: As the president threatens Venezuela, Russia and China are filling the information vacuum.

item.title: The ‘two-income trap’ is nonsense. Here’s a real problem.
item.description: No, $140K is not the poverty line. But benefit “cliffs” are a serious issue.

item.title: The Supreme Court can strike another blow against political cynicism
item.description: Campaign finance reformers’ nibbling away at the First Amendment is gradually being reversed. Good.

item.title: Populists are replacing meritocracy with something far worse
item.description: Undermining expertise is a pretext for consolidating power among the ultra-wealthy.
